top_categories.workout_context: Noosa Gravel Enduro's Gravel roads, Forest tracks forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 62 miles.
81ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Noosa Gravel Enduro's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before June.
At Noosa Gravel Enduro, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Noosa Gravel Enduro. Train it until it feels boring.
62 miles on hinterland gravel and forest roads burns energy faster than the distance suggests. Train the fade resistance now.
5,000ft of climbing on grades that change every minute. You need to switch from seated to standing without losing rhythm.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Noosa Gravel Enduro, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
5,000ft of climbing means repeated surges above threshold. VO2max work is how you survive the fifth climb, not just the first.
Low-cadence force work for 5,000ft of climbing. The slow, grinding ascents where you can't spin—you push.
Short, max efforts are unavoidable. Punchy climbs, gap closures, attacks on hinterland gravel and forest roads. If you haven't trained them, you'll crack.
Double-threshold training builds sustained power with less fatigue. More FTP per hour of training.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Noosa Gravel Enduro’s 62 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Noosa Gravel Enduro requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on hinterland gravel and forest roads to build confidence. Expect: gravel roads, forest tracks, hinterland terrain.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, TT Threshold, and Race Simulation to prepare you for 62 miles of hinterland gravel and forest roads in Noosa Hinterland, Queensland.
